sense.gloss: using freely, making full use of, having a good command of
pioneer, leader, taking the initiative, forerunner, harbinger, herald
leading an attack, charging ahead of others (towards the enemy)
starting to run, running off, running away
to run to, to come running, to rush (someplace), to hasten
to run, to dash, to race
to advance (against one's enemy), to charge (on horseback)
to run through (a crowd, gate, etc.), to sweep through (e.g. of news through a city)
to run past (someone) from behind, to overtake
to run into, to rush into
to (run and) seek refuge in, to take shelter in
to flush out (game, etc.), to drive (animals), to beat, to hunt down
to urge, to spur on, to push on, to impel
elopement, running away with a lover
to run around, to bustle about
to rush over, to run up to
to run up (a hill, stairs etc.), to dash up, to rush up
to spur on, to urge forward, to impel
to drive at high speed (e.g. a car)
to do (something) before (something or someone else), to be ahead of (others, the times, etc.)
outrider (person riding horseback in the lead position of a cavalcade), outriding
to run off, to break into a run, to start running
riding fast, driving a horse fast
three cups of sake which latecomers to a party are made to drink
to chase, to run after, to pursue
to go smoothly, to turn out well, to do the trick, to have peaceful relations
to hunt out, to flush out, to round up
pioneer, trailblazer, leader, groundbreaker, pathfinder, forerunner
running around, making every effort (to do), exerting oneself
to run around (wildly), to rush about all over the place
to make every effort (to do), to do everything one can
to be driven by (a feeling, impulse, etc.), to be carried away by, to be seized with, to be stricken with, to be impelled by, to be spurred on by, to succumb to
stealing a march on, getting a head start, secretly acting before others
solo raid on an enemy's camp (for glory)

sdata.j: ↑空腹↑↓くうふく↓が↑彼↑↓かれ↓を↑盗↑↓ぬす↓みに↑駆↑↓か↓り↑立↑↓た↓てた。
sdata.e: Hunger drove him to steal.

sdata.j: ↑駆↑↓か↓け↑出↑↓だ↓しの↑新聞↑↓しんぶん↓↑記者↑↓きしゃ↓にしては↑腕↑↓うで↓がいい。
sdata.e: You are doing well for a cub reporter.

sdata.j: ↑急↑↓いそ↓いで↑家↑↓いえ↓から↑駆↑↓か↓け↑出↑↓だ↓した。
sdata.e: I rushed out of my house.

sdata.j: ↑丘↑↓おか↓を↑駆↑↓か↓け↑登↑↓のぼ↓った↑後↑↓のち↓、↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑完全↑↓かんぜん↓に↑息切↑↓いきぎ↓れしていた。
sdata.e: After running up the hill, I was completely out of breath.

sdata.j: ↑外交↑↓がいこう↓の↑駆↑↓か↓け↑引↑↓ひ↓きでは、とても↑彼↑↓かれ↓には↑及↑↓およ↓ばない。
sdata.e: I am no match for him in diplomatic shrewdness.

sdata.j: ↑階段↑↓かいだん↓を↑駆↑↓か↓け↑上↑↓あ↓がったので、↑息↑↓いき↓が↑切↑↓き↓れた。
sdata.e: I'm out of breath after running up the stairs.

sdata.j: ↑海洋↑↓かいよう↓↑研究↑↓けんきゅう↓の↑歴史↑↓れきし↓の↑先駆↑↓さきが↓けとなったのは、↑探検↑↓たんけん↓のための↑航海↑↓こうかい↓だった。
sdata.e: Voyages of exploration were the earliest in the history of studying the ocean.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑馬↑↓うま↓を↑飛↑↓と↓ばしてその↑丘↑↓おか↓を↑駆↑↓か↓け↑抜↑↓ぬ↓けた。
sdata.e: We had a gallop over the hill.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓はあの↑丘↑↓おか↓を↑駆↑↓か↓けおりた。
sdata.e: We ran down the hill.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓の↑家↑↓いえ↓からゴキブリを↑駆除↑↓くじょ↓するのはとても↑難↑↓むずか↓しい。
sdata.e: It is very hard to get rid of cockroaches from our house.

sdata.j: マスコミが↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑婚約↑↓こんやく↓の↑噂↑↓うわさ↓を↑嗅↑↓か↓ぎつけ↑早速↑↓さっそく↓↑駆↑↓か↓けつけた。
sdata.e: The media got wind of a rumor about his engagement and came quickly.

sdata.j: ↑報道陣↑↓ほうどうじん↓が↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑婚約↑↓こんやく↓の↑噂↑↓うわさ↓を↑嗅↑↓か↓ぎつけ↑早速↑↓さっそく↓↑駆↑↓か↓け↑付↑↓つ↓けました。
sdata.e: The media got wind of a rumor about his engagement and came quickly.

sdata.j: ↑雨↑↓あめ↓が↑降↑↓ふ↓り↑始↑↓はじ↓めたので、↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑家↑↓いえ↓に↑駆↑↓か↓け↑込↑↓こ↓んだ。
sdata.e: As it began to rain, I ran into my house.

sdata.j: ↑悪貨↑↓あっか↓は↑良貨↑↓りょうか↓を↑駆逐↑↓くちく↓する。
sdata.e: Bad money drives out good.

sdata.j: ものすごい↑勢↑↓いきお↓いで↑駆↑↓か↓けていった。
sdata.e: He was flying down the road.

sdata.j: すごい↑勢↑↓いきお↓いで↑駆↑↓か↓けていったよ。
sdata.e: He was flying down the road.

sdata.j: そんなに↑騒々↑↓そうぞう↓しく↑階段↑↓かいだん↓を↑駆↑↓か↓け↑下↑↓お↓りるな。
sdata.e: Don't run down the stairs so noisily.

sdata.j: それを↑聞↑↓き↓いて↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑逸早↑↓いちはや↓く↑現場↑↓げんば↓に↑駆↑↓か↓けつけた。
sdata.e: As soon as he heard of it, he hastened to the spot.

sdata.j: それから↑服↑↓ふく↓を↑着↑↓き↓て、↑講義↑↓こうぎ↓↑用↑↓よう↓のメモを↑手↑↓て↓さげ↑鞄↑↓かばん↓に↑詰↑↓つ↓め↑込↑↓こ↓み、↑階段↑↓かいだん↓を↑駆↑↓か↓け↑下↑↓お↓りた。
sdata.e: Then he got dressed, stuffed his lecture notes into his briefcase, and ran down the stairs.

sdata.j: その↑家↑↓いえ↓に↑火↑↓ひ↓がついたとき↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑恐怖↑↓きょうふ↓の↑念↑↓ねん↓に↑駆↑↓か↓られた。
sdata.e: When the house caught fire, an awful feeling came over me.

sdata.j: そうだな、↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑時計↑↓とけい↓が↑止↑↓と↓まったので↑彼↑↓かれ↓が↑時間↑↓じかん↓を↑知↑↓し↓っているかどうか、たずねただけだ。↑彼↑↓かれ↓はただ↑駆↑↓か↓け↑出↑↓だ↓しただけだ。
sdata.e: Well, I just asked him if he knew the time, because my watch has stopped, and he simply bolted.

sdata.j: ジョンが↑部屋↑↓へや↓に↑駆↑↓か↓け↑込↑↓こ↓んできた。
sdata.e: John came running into the room.

sdata.j: さあ、↑駆↑↓か↓けつけ↑三↑↓さん↓↑杯↑↓はい↓、↑威勢↑↓いせい↓よくぱっといきましょう。
sdata.e: Anybody who shows up late has to chug!

sdata.j: ケンは↑坂↑↓さか↓を↑駆↑↓か↓け↑上↑↓のぼ↓った。
sdata.e: Ken dashed up the slope.

sdata.j: クロッカスは↑春↑↓はる↓の↑先駆↑↓さきが↓けである。
sdata.e: The crocus is a forerunner of spring.

sdata.j: アンとザチャリーは↑駆↑↓か↓け↑落↑↓お↓ちしたらしいんだ。
sdata.e: It seems Ann and Zachary ran off together.

sdata.j: ５↑台↑↓だい↓の↑消防車↑↓しょうぼうしゃ↓が↑火事↑↓かじ↓の↑現場↑↓げんば↓に↑駆↑↓か↓けつけた。
sdata.e: Five fire engines rushed to the scene of the fire.

sdata.j: 「わたしは↑森↑↓もり↓の↑中↑↓なか↓に↑入↑↓はい↓って、↑山↑↓やま↓に↑駆↑↓か↓け↑上↑↓あ↓がったことを↑後悔↑↓こうかい↓していない。」と↑弟↑↓おとうと↓は↑答↑↓こた↓えた。
sdata.e: I do not regret having gone into the forest and up the mountain, replied the younger brother.

sdata.j: ↑犬↑↓いぬ↓が↑私↑↓わたし↓のところに↑駆↑↓か↓けよってきた。
sdata.e: The dog came running up to me.

sdata.j: ↑犬↑↓いぬ↓はぐるぐる↑駆↑↓か↓け↑回↑↓まわ↓った。
sdata.e: The dog ran around and around.
